Package GUI

Class GameEnvironment

java.lang.Object
GUI.GameEnvironment
public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
This class initializes GameLogic which is used to run the main logic and launches the application windows for the GUI. Windows can only be accessed in the set order to ensure the game runs smoothly.
Version:
0.3, 19 May 2021.
Author:
John Elliott

    GameEnvironment()

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeEndScreen​(EndScreen endWindow)
    Ends the game.
    void closeMainGameScreen​(MainGameScreen mainGameScreen, boolean won)
    Closes the instance of the main game screen and pass the "won game" state to the end screen.
    void closeSailScreen​(SailScreen sailWindow, boolean sailed)
    Closes the sailing screen.
    void closeSetupScreen​(SetUpScreen setupWindow)
    Closes the SetUpScreen and launches the main game window.

    Closes the StartUpScreen and launches the SetUpScreen.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEnvironment

      public GameEnvironment()

  • Method Details

    • getGame

      public GameLogic getGame()
      Returns instance of game from GameLogic.
      Returns:
      game The game logic.

    • launchStartupScreen

      public void launchStartupScreen()
      Launches a new instance of the StartUpScreen. an introductory screen for the game.

    • closeStartupScreen

      public void closeStartupScreen​(StartUpScreen startupWindow)
      Closes the StartUpScreen and launches the SetUpScreen.
      Parameters:
      startupWindow - Instance of StartUpScreen.

    • launchSetupScreen

      public void launchSetupScreen()
      Launches the games SetUpScreen. This window contains many options that provide players with ways to customize their game-play. further detail on specific options and functionality is provided in the documentation for the class.

    • closeSetupScreen

      public void closeSetupScreen​(SetUpScreen setupWindow)
      Closes the SetUpScreen and launches the main game window.
      Parameters:
      setupWindow - Instance of SetUpScreen.

    • launchMainScreen

      public void launchMainScreen()
      Launches the games MainGameScreen. This window contains the main game GUI and is where the user plays the game. further information and details are provided in the documentation for the class.

    • closeMainGameScreen

      public void closeMainGameScreen​(MainGameScreen mainGameScreen, boolean won)
      Closes the instance of the main game screen and pass the "won game" state to the end screen.
      Parameters:
      mainGameScreen - The main screen object.
      won - The win state.

    • launchEndScreen

      public void launchEndScreen​(boolean won)
      Launches the games end screen which shows the final score of the player.
      Parameters:
      won - The win state.

    • closeEndScreen

      public void closeEndScreen​(EndScreen endWindow)
      Ends the game.
      Parameters:
      endWindow - The end screen object.

    • launchSailScreen

      public void launchSailScreen​(int islandIndex)
      Launches the games sailing screen. Which allows the player to sail to a island.
      Parameters:
      islandIndex - The island they are wanting to sail to.

    • closeSailScreen

      public void closeSailScreen​(SailScreen sailWindow, boolean sailed)
      Closes the sailing screen. This then makes checks with the game logic if the game is still playable. If it is it will launch the game back to the main screen. Otherwise it will close the main screen and launch the end screen.
      Parameters:
      sailWindow - The sail screen object.
      sailed - A boolean value representing if the player had sailed.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method that initializes this GameEnvironment object and starts the game.
      Parameters:
      args - Any strings received through the terminal.
